Hi Alberto,

On 1/30/07, albsavoia <albsavoia@...> wrote:
>  > "TDD, BDD, DDD, STDD, CTDD, ATDD, DDV, DVD, STD, ADD. Which of these
>  > doesn't belong?"
>
>  OK Lasse, I'll bite.
>
>  TDD: Test Driven Development - that's easy
>  BDD: Behavior Driven Development
>  DDD: Data Driven Development?
>  STDD: Software Testing Driven Development???
>  CTDD: Continuous Testing Driven Development???
>  ATDD: Automated Test Driven Development????
>  DDV: ???
>  DVD: ???
>  STD: Sexually Transmitted Development :-) ???
>  ADD: In my company this stands for Agitation Driven Development
>
>  Please help us with these esoteric acronyms :-).

You got the first two correct (ok, the last one is an edge case ;)
Here's the key for the remaining acronyms:

DDD: Domain-Driven Design
STDD: Story Test-Driven Development
CTDD: Customer Test-Driven Development
ATDD: Acceptance Test-Driven Development
DDV: Developer-Driven Victory...
DVD: Digital Versatile Disc
STD: Catching the test-first bug from a colleague ;-)
ADD: Attempt-Driven Development


On 1/30/07, albsavoia <albsavoia@...> wrote:
>  In the meantime I'll post acronyms for what is actually practiced in
>  the majority of organizations:
>
>  TFD: Test-Free Development
>  TIQR: Testing Is QA's Responsibility
>  TWDNNST: Tests, We Don't Need No Stinkin' Tests
>  TALAP: Test As Little As Possible
>  UTMOT: Unit Testing Means One Test

Mmm. A couple of real good ones. TIQR triggered a memory of an email
from an operations guy a couple of years ago:

    "QA is not a f***ing testing environment!"

He wasn't happy with us requesting deployments for our software so often...


Lasse
